Application helper APIs

Files

file  bsputils_app.h
 Header file to use application level helper functions.
 

Macros

#define BSPUTILS_APP_TST_STATUS_PASS   (0x50415353U)
 Magic String for App Test Status : PASS.
 
#define BSPUTILS_APP_TST_STATUS_FAIL   (0x46417376U)
 Magic String for App Test Status : FAIL.
 
#define BSPUTILS_APP_TST_STATUS_INIT   (0x494E4954U)
 Magic String for App Test Status : Started.
 
#define BSPUTILS_APP_TST_STATUS_AINF   (0x41494E46U)
 Magic String for App Test Status : AppImage not found.
 
#define BSPUTILS_APP_TST_ADDR   (0x4033B100U)
 OCMC Address used to store App Test Status.

void BspUtils_appServiceWatchdog (void)
 Services the watchdog timer set by SBL. For TDA2x/TDA2Ex wd timer 2 is refreshed. For TDA3xx RTI instance 4 is refreshed if enabled.

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

Int32 BspUtils_appDefaultDeInit ( UInt32  isI2cDeInitReq)

BSP application utils function to call all the default de-init functions.

Note that this function calls the BspUtils_appDeInit() as well and hence the application should not call BspUtils_appDeInit() separately.

Parameters
isI2cDeInitReq[IN] TRUE -> Calls I2C/device init. FALSE -> I2C/device deinit are not called. This will be overridden for non-EVM based platforms and FALSE will be used.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate error code on failure.
Int32 BspUtils_appDefaultInit ( UInt32  isI2cInitReq)

BSP application utils function to call all the default init functions.

Note that this function calls the BspUtils_appInit() as well and hence the application should not call BspUtils_appInit() separately.

Parameters
isI2cInitReq[IN] TRUE -> Calls I2C/device init. FALSE -> I2C and device init are not called. This will be overridden for non-EVM based platforms and FALSE will be used.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate error code on failure.
Int32 BspUtils_appDefaultSerialDeInit ( UInt32  isI2cDeInitReq)

BSP application utils function to call all the default de-init functions related to serial driver. This doesn't call VPS de-init.

Note that this function calls the BspUtils_appDeInit() as well and hence the application should not call BspUtils_appDeInit() separately.

Parameters
isI2cDeInitReq[IN] TRUE -> Calls I2C/device init. FALSE -> I2C/device deinit are not called. This will be overridden for non-EVM based platforms and FALSE will be used.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate error code on failure.
Int32 BspUtils_appDefaultSerialInit ( UInt32  isI2cInitReq)

BSP application utils function to call all the default init functions related to serial driver. This doesn't call VPS init.

Note that this function calls the BspUtils_appInit() as well and hence the application should not call BspUtils_appInit() separately.

Parameters
isI2cInitReq[IN] TRUE -> Calls I2C/device init. FALSE -> I2C and device init are not called. This will be overridden for non-EVM based platforms and FALSE will be used.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate error code on failure.
Int32 BspUtils_appDeInit ( void  )

BSP application utils deinit function.

De-init function which frees already allocated objects.

Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate error code on failure.
UInt32 BspUtils_appGetCrc ( const UInt8 *  bufPtr,
UInt32  numBytes 
)

This function returns the CRC of the provided buffer.

Parameters
bufPtrBuffer pointer
numBytesBuffer size in bytes
Returns
Calculated CRC.
void* BspUtils_appGetEdmaHandle ( void  )

API to get access to the application default EDMA handle as a pointer to void.

Returns
EDMA3_DRV_Handle
void BspUtils_appGetFileName ( Char *  fileNameString,
UInt32  fileNameSize,
const Char *  fileStr,
UInt32  dataFormat,
UInt32  width,
UInt32  height 
)

Function to create filename based on the data format buffer width and buffer height.

Parameters
fileNameString[IN] char ptr to store File name.
fileNameSize[IN] Size of File name string.
fileStr[IN] File name prefix string.
dataFormat[IN] FVID2 Data format.
width[IN] Width of buffer in pixels.
height[IN] Height of buffer in lines.
Int32 BspUtils_appInit ( void  )

BSP application utils init function.

Init function which allocates semaphore and initializes global objects.

This function should be called before calling any of the below API's and should be called only once after doing all other module initialization like FIVD2 init, device init and platform init.

Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropiate error code on failure.
void BspUtils_appLogTestResult ( UInt32  testResult)

This function used to log the test result of Examples.

Parameters
testResultStatus of testResult
void BspUtils_appPrintLoadRawCmd ( const Char *  fileStr,
const void *  bufAddr,
UInt32  dataFormat,
UInt32  width,
UInt32  height 
)

Function to print the loadRaw command used to load buffers from file through CCS scripting console.

Parameters
fileStr[IN] File name string.
bufAddr[IN] Buffer address.
dataFormat[IN] FVID2 Data format.
width[IN] Width of buffer in pixels.
height[IN] Height of buffer in lines.
void BspUtils_appPrintSaveRawCmd ( const Char *  fileStr,
const void *  bufAddr,
UInt32  dataFormat,
UInt32  width,
UInt32  height,
UInt32  bufSize 
)

Function to print the saveRaw command used to save buffers to file through CCS scripting console.

Parameters
fileStr[IN] File name string.
bufAddr[IN] Buffer address.
dataFormat[IN] FVID2 Data format.
width[IN] Width of buffer in pixels.
height[IN] Height of buffer in lines.
bufSize[IN] Buffer size in bytes so that multiple buffers could be saved.
